S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Accept AMVER
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: A statement that expresses if it accepts AMVER(Automated Mutual-Assistance Vessel Rescue system) reports

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Action or Activity
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The action or activity of a vessel.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Navigating With a Pilot
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Carrying a qualified pilot as part of the vessel navigation team.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Entering Port
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Navigating a vessel into a port.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Leaving Port
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Navigating a vessel out of a port.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Berthing
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Attaching a vessel to a wharf or jetty.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Slipping
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Detaching a vessel from a wharf or jetty.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Anchoring
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Attaching a vessel to the seabed by means of an anchor and cable.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Weighing Anchor
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Detaching a vessel from the seabed by recovering an anchor and cable.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Transiting
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Navigating a vessel along a route or through a narrow gap, such as under a bridge or through a lock.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Overtaking
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Navigating a vessel past another traveling broadly in the same direction.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Reporting
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Providing details such as the name, location or intentions of a vessel.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Working Cargo
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Loading or unloading cargo.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Landing
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Placing crew or passengers on shore.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Diving
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A signal or message warning of diving activity.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Fishing
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Hunting or catching fish.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Discharging Overboard
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Releasing anything into the sea; often ballast water; or spoil from dredging elsewhere.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Passing
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Navigating a vessel past another travelling broadly in the opposite direction.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Administrative Division
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: A generic term for an administrative region within a country at a level below that of the sovereign state.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Base Station Antenna Height
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Antenna height of the base station in meter.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Call Name
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The designated call name of a station; for example, radio station, radar station, pilot.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: This is the name used when calling a radio station by radio; for example, "Singapore Pilots".

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Call Sign
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The designated call-sign of a station (radio station, radar station, pilot, ...).

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Contact Instructions
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Instructions provided on how to contact a particular person, organisation or service.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Category of Authority
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The type of person, government agency or organisation granted powers of managing or controlling access to and/or activity in an area.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Border Control
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The administration to prevent or detect and prosecute violations of rules and regulations at international boundaries.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Police
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The department of government, or civil force, charged with maintaining public order.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Port
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Person or corporation, owners of, or entrusted with or invested with the power of managing a port. May be called a Harbour Board, Port Trust, Port Commission, Harbour Commission, Marine Department.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Immigration
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The authority controlling people entering a country.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Health
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The authority with responsibility for checking the validity of the health declaration of a vessel and for declaring free pratique.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Coast Guard
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Organization keeping watch on shipping and coastal waters according to governmental law; normally the authority with responsibility for search and rescue.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Agricultural
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The authority with responsibility for preventing infection of the agriculture of a country and for the protection of the agricultural interests of a country.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Military
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A military authority which provides control of access to or approval for transit through designated areas or airspace.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Private Company
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A private or publicly owned company or commercial enterprise which exercises control of facilities, for example a calibration area.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Maritime Police
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A governmental or military force with jurisdiction in territorial waters. Examples could include Gendarmerie Maritime, Carabinierie, and Guardia Civil.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Environmental
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: An authority with responsibility for the protection of the environment.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Fishery
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: An authority with responsibility for the control of fisheries.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Finance
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: An authority with responsibility for the control and movement of money.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Maritime
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A national or regional authority charged with administration of maritime affairs.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Customs
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The agency or establishment for collecting duties, tolls.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Category of Broadcast/Communication
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Classification of broadcast or communications based on public availability and commercial/non-commercial nature.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Commercial
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A service operated with the intention of earning money.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Non-Commercial
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A service without any financial interest.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Public
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Belonging to, available to, used or shared by, the community as a whole and not restricted to private use.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Non-Public
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A service available for limited and predefined customers.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Category of Cargo
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Classification of the different types of cargo that a ship may be carrying.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: If item 7 is used, the nature of dangerous or hazardous cargoes can be amplified with category of dangerous or hazardous cargo.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Bulk
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Unpacked homogenous cargo poured loose in a certain space of a vessel, for example oil or grain.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Container
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: One of a number of standard sized cargo carrying units, secured using standard corner attachments and bar.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: General
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Break bulk cargo normally loaded by crane.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Liquid
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Any cargo loaded by pipeline.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Passenger
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A fee paying traveller.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Livestock
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Live animals carried in bulk.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Dangerous or Hazardous
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Dangerous or hazardous cargo as described by the IMO International Maritime Dangerous Goods code.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Heavy Lift
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Indivisible heavy items of weight generally over 100 tons, and width or height greater than 100 metres.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Ballast
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Material carried by a ship to ensure its stability.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Dry Bulk Cargo
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Commodity cargo that is transported unpackaged in large quantities. These types of goods usually need to be kept dry during the whole transportation period.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Liquid Bulk Cargo
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Liquids or gases that are transported in bulk and carried unpackaged.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Reefer Container Cargo
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Cargo transported in refrigerated containers, generally perishable commodities which require temperature-controlled transportation, such as fruit, meat, fish, vegetables, dairy products and other foods.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Ro-Ro Cargo
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Wheeled cargo, such as cars, busses, trucks, agricultural vehicles and cranes, that are driven on and off the ship on their own wheels or using a platform vehicle, such as a self-propelled modular transporter.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Project Cargo
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Project cargo is a term used to broadly describe the national or international transportation of large, heavy, high value, or critical (to the project they are intended for) pieces of equipment. Also commonly referred to as heavy lift, this includes shipments made of various components which need disassembly for shipment and reassembly after delivery.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Break Bulk Cargo
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Goods that are stowed on board ship in individually counted units, and not in intermodal containers nor in bulk as with oil or grain.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Category Of Dangerous Or Hazardous Cargo
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Classification of dangerous goods or hazardous materials based on the International Maritime Dangerous Goods Code (IMDG Code).

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: IMDG Code Class 1 Div. 1.1
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Explosives, Division 1: Substances and articles which have a mass explosion hazard.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: IMDG Code Class 1 Div. 1.2
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Explosives, Division 2: Substances and articles which have a projection hazard but not a mass explosion hazard.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: IMDG Code Class 1 Div. 1.3
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Explosives, Division 3: Substances and articles which have a fire hazard and either a minor blast hazard or a minor projection hazard or both, but not a mass explosion hazard.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: IMDG Code Class 1 Div. 1.4
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Explosives, Division 4: Substances and articles which present no significant hazard.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: IMDG Code Class 1 Div. 1.5
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Explosives, Division 5: Very insensitive substances which have a mass explosion hazard.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: IMDG Code Class 1 Div. 1.6
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Explosives, Division 6: Extremely insensitive articles which do not have a mass explosion hazard.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: IMDG Code Class 2 Div. 2.1
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Gases, flammable gases.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: IMDG Code Class 2 Div. 2.2
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Gases, non-flammable, non-toxic gases.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: IMDG Code Class 2 Div. 2.3
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Gases, toxic gases.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: IMDG Code Class 3
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Flammable liquids.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: IMDG Code Class 4 Div. 4.1
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Flammable solids, self-reactive substances and desensitized explosives.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: IMDG Code Class 4 Div. 4.2
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Substances liable to spontaneous combustion.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: IMDG Code Class 4 Div. 4.3
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Substances which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: IMDG Code Class 5 Div. 5.1
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Oxidizing substances.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: IMDG Code Class 5 Div. 5.2
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Organic peroxides.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: IMDG Code Class 6 Div. 6.1
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Toxic substances.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: IMDG Code Class 6 Div. 6.2
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Infectious substances.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: IMDG Code Class 7
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Radioactive material.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: IMDG Code Class 8
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Corrosive substances.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: IMDG Code Class 9
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Miscellaneous dangerous substances and articles.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Harmful Substances in Packaged Form
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Harmful substances are those substances which are identified as marine pollutants in the International Maritime Dangerous Goods Code (IMDG Code). Packaged form is defined as the forms of containment specified for harmful substances in the IMDG Code.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Category of Forecast or Warning Area
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Classification of weather forecast and weather warning areas based on source of warnings and forecasts.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: World Meteorological Organization (WMO)
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The forecast and warning area defined by WMO.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: National High Seas
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The forecast and warning area defined by national authorities covering High Seas.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: National Offshore
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The forecast and warning area defined by national authorities covering offshore waters.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: National Coastal
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The forecast and warning area defined by national authorities covering coastal waters.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: National Inshore
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The forecast and warning area defined by national authorities covering inshore waters.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: National Local
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The forecast and warning area defined by national authorities covering local waters.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Ice
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The solid form of water.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Category of GMDSS Area
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Classification of GMDSS areas based on availability of GMDSS services and GMDSS equipment requirements.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Area A1
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Within range of VHF coast stations with continuous DSC alerting available (about 20 30 miles).

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Area A2
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Beyond area A1, but within range of MF coastal stations with continuous DSC alerting available (about l00 miles).

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Area A3
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Beyond Area 1 and Area 2, but within coverage of geostationary maritime communication satellites (in practice this means Inmarsat). This covers the area between roughly 70 deg N and 70 deg S.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Area A4
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The sea areas beyond Area 3. The most important of these is the sea around the North Pole (the area around the South Pole is mostly land). Geostationary satellites, which are positioned above the equator, cannot reach this far.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Category of Radio Station
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Classification of radio services offered by a radio station.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: A radiobeacon is a radio transmitter which emits a distinctive or characteristic signal on which a bearing may be taken.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Radio Direction-Finding Station
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A radio station intended to determine only the direction of other stations by means of transmission from the latter.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Loran C
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A low frequency electronic position fixing system using pulsed transmissions at 100 Khz.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Differential GNSS
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Differential GNSS is implemented by placing a GNSS monitor receiver at a precisely known location. Instead of computing a navigation fix, the monitor determines the range error to every GNSS satellite it can track. These ranging errors are then transmitted to local users where they are applied as corrections before computing the navigation result.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Radio Telephone Station
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The equipment needed at one station to carry on two way voice communication by radio waves only.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: AIS Base Station
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: An AIS shore station for use by competent authorities to provide AIS service, manage the data link and enable effective ship to shore / shore to ship transmission of information.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Category of Relationship
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Expresses constraints or requirements on vessel actions or activities in relation to a geographic feature, facility, or service.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Prohibited
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Use of facility, waterway or service is forbidden.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Not Recommended
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Use of facility, waterway or service is not recommended.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Permitted
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Use of facility, waterway, or service is permitted but not required.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Recommended
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Use of facility, waterway, or service is recommended.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Required
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Use of facility, waterway, or service is required.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Not Required
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Use of facility, waterway, or service is not required.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Category of RxN
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The principal subject matter of regulations, restrictions, recommendations or nautical information.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Navigation
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The process of directing the movement of a craft from one point to another.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Communication
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Transmitting and/or receiving electronic communication signals.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Environmental Protection
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Pertaining to environmental protection.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Wildlife Protection
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Pertaining to wildlife protection.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Security
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Pertaining to security.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Customs
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The agency or establishment for collecting duties, tolls.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Cargo Operation
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Pertaining to cargo operations.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Refuge
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Pertaining to a place of safety or refuge.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Health
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The authority with responsibility for checking the validity of the health declaration of a vessel and for declaring free pratique.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Natural Resources or Exploitation
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Pertaining to natural resources or exploitation.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Port
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Person or corporation, owners of, or entrusted with or invested with the power of managing a port. May be called a Harbour Board, Port Trust, Port Commission, Harbour Commission, Marine Department.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Finance
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: An authority with responsibility for the control and movement of money.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Agriculture
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The science, art, or practice of cultivating the soil, producing crops, and raising livestock and in varying degrees the preparation and marketing of the resulting products.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Category of Schedule
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The type of schedule, for instance opening, closure, etc.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Normal Operation
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The service, office, is open, fully manned, and operating normally, or the area is accessible as usual.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Closure
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The service, office, or area is closed.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Unmanned Operation
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The service is available but not manned.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Category of Temporal Variation
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: An assessment of the likelihood of change over time.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Extreme Event
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Indication of the possible impact of a significant event (for example hurricane, earthquake, volcanic eruption, landslide, etc), which is considered likely to have changed the seafloor or landscape significantly.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Likely to Change
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Continuous or frequent change to non-bathymetric features (for example river siltation, glacier creep/recession, sand dunes, buoys, marine farms, etc).

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Unlikely to Change
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Significant change to the seafloor is not expected.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Category of Text
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Classification of completeness of textual information in relation to the source material from which it is derived.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Abstract or Summary
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A statement summarizing the important points of a text.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Extract
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: An excerpt or excerpts from a text.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Full Text
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The whole text.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Category of Vessel
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Classification of vessels by function or use.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: General Cargo Vessel
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A vessel which is designed for carrying general cargo, e.g. boxes, sacks.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Container Carrier
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A vessel designed to carry ISO containers.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Tanker
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A vessel which is designed for carrying liquid goods, for example oil or water.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Bulk Carrier
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A vessel which is designed for carrying bulk goods, e.g. coal, ore or grain.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Passenger Vessel
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A day trip or cabin vessel constructed and equipped to carry more than 12 passengers.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Roll-On Roll-Off
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A vessel designed to allow road vehicles to be driven on and off; often a ferry.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Refrigerated Cargo Vessel
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A vessel designed to carry refrigerated cargo.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Fishing Vessel
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A vessel that is used and equipped for the fishing of living aquatic resources.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Service
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A vessel which provides a service such as a tug, anchor handler, survey or supply vessel.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Warship
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A vessel designed for the conduct of military operations.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Towed or Pushed Composite Unit
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Either a tug and tow, or any combination of a tug providing propulsion to barges or vessels secured ahead or alongside.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Tug and Tow
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A combination of tug(s) and non-powered tow(s).

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Light Recreational
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A pleasure boat or watercraft, or an excursion vessel used for short cruises such as whale watching.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Semi-Submersible Offshore Installation
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: An installation which is designed to float at all times and which is normally anchored in position when deployed in the offshore gas and oil industry.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Jack-Up Exploration or Project Installation
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: An exploration or project installation with legs which can be raised and lowered. The legs are raised when the installation is re-positioned. When stationary the legs are lowered to the sea floor and the working platform is raised clear of the sea surface.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Livestock Carrier
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A vessel designed to carry large quantities of live animals.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Sport Fishing
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A vessel used in fishing for pleasure or competition.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Category of Vessel Registry
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The locality of vessel registration or enrolment relative to the nationality of a port, territorial sea, administrative area, exclusive zone or other location.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Domestic
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The vessel is registered or enrolled under the same national flag as the port, harbour, territorial sea, exclusive economic zone, or administrative area in which the object that possesses this attribute applies or is located.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Foreign
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The vessel is registered or enrolled under a national flag different from the port, harbour, territorial sea, exclusive economic zone, or other administrative area in which the object that possesses this attribute applies or is located.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Category of Connectivity Subscription
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Category of the communication system providing the connectivity coverage for subscription.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Satellite Communication GEO
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Communication using GEO (Geosynchronous Earth Orbit) satellites

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Satellite Communication LEO
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Communication using LEO (Low Earth Orbit) satellites

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Cellular Communication
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Communication using cellular network. Cellular netwotk or mobile network enables wireless communication between mobile devices. The final stage of connectivity is achieved by segmenting the comprehensive service area into several compact zones, each called a cell. A stationary transceiver, known as a cell site or base station, provides service in each cell. The cell site links to the primary network infrastructure, employing either a wireless or wired connection.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Terrestrial Ad-Hoc Communication
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Communication using ad-hoc networking, which uses whatever resources available to create communication paths from an end-user device to its desired destination, independent from central network infrastructure or administration.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Class of Emission
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The set of characteristics of an emission, designated by standard symbols, e.g. type of modulation of the main carrier, modulating signal, type of information to be transmitted, and also, if appropriate, any additional signal characteristics. (ITU Radio Regulations)
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: For example, F1B, G2B, J3E

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Coast Station Identification Code
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: A code, issued according to a standard and coordination procedure, to identify the transmission of a coast radio station.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Communication Channel
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: A channel number assigned to a specific radio frequency, frequencies or frequency band.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: The expected input is the specific VHF-Channel. The attribute 'communication channel' encodes the various VHF-channels used for communication.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Communication Standard
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The communications standard applicable to accessing the radio service.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Comparison Operator
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Numerical comparison.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: Provides the relation between the value given in the model and the real ship's value.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Greater Than
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The value of the left value is greater than that of the right.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Greater Than or Equal To
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The value of the left expression is greater than or equal to that of the right.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Less Than
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The value of the left expression is less than that of the right.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Less Than or Equal To
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The value of the left expression is less than or equal to that of the right.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Equal To
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The two values are equivalent.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Not Equal To
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The two values are not equivalent.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Country Name
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The name of a nation.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: City Name
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The name of a town or city.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Data Transmission Rate
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The average number of bits communicated (transmitted) in 1 second. (ITU Terms and Definitions)

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Date End
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The latest date on which an object (for example a buoy) will be present.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: The Date End should be encoded using 4 digits for the calendar year (YYYY), 2 digits for the month (MM) (for example April = 04) and 2 digits for the day (DD). When no specific month and/or day is required/known, indication of the month and/or day is omitted, and replaced with dashes (-). When no specific year is required (that is, the event or date range ends at the same time each year) the following two cases may be considered:- same day each year: ----MMDD- same month each year: ----MM--This conforms to ISO 8601: 2004. Date End indicates the latest date of an event or the end of a date range. It is used to indicate the end of a fixed date range, the end of a periodic date range, or the removal or cancellation of a feature at a specific date in the future.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Date Fixed
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The date of an event.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Date Start
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The earliest date on which an object (for example a buoy) will be present.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: The Date Start should be encoded using 4 digits for the calendar year (YYYY), 2 digits for the month (MM) (for example April = 04) and 2 digits for the day (DD). When no specific month and/or day is required/known, indication of the month and/or day is omitted, and replaced with dashes (-). When no specific year is required (that is, the event or date range ends at the same time each year) the following two cases may be considered:- same day each year: ----MMDD- same month each year: ----MM--This conforms to ISO 8601: 2004. Date Start indicates the earliest date of an event or the start of a date range. It is used to indicate the start of a fixed date range, the start of a periodic date range, or the deployment or implementation of a feature at a specific date in the future.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Date Variable
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: A day which is not fixed in the Gregorian calendar.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: Examples: The fourth Thursday in November; new moon day of Kartika (Diwali); Easter Sunday.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Day of Week
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Any one of seven days in a week.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Sunday
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The day of the week following Saturday and preceding Monday.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Monday
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The day of the week following Sunday and preceding Tuesday.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Tuesday
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The day of the week following Monday and preceding Wednesday.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Wednesday
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The day of the week following Tuesday and preceding Thursday.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Thursday
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The day of the week following Wednesday and preceding Friday.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Friday
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The day of the week following Thursday and preceding Saturday.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Saturday
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The day of the week following Friday and preceding Sunday.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Day of Week is Range
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: A statement expressing if the days of the week identified define a range or not.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: A True value is an indication that the identified days of the week define a range between and inclusive of those days.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Delivery Point
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Details of where post can be delivered such as the apartment, name and/or number of a street, building or PO Box.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Distance
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: A numeric measure of the spatial separation between two locations.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Downlink Bandwidth
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Downlink bandwidth in Mbps

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Drawing Instruction
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Text describing one or more graphic elements that must be rendered in an end-user system.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Estimated Range of Transmission
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The estimated range of a non-optical electromagnetic transmission.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: The estimated range (distance) assumes 'in vacuo' transmission and a standard antenna height of 5 metres. Thus it gives a hint to the mariner whether they are likely to receive transmission at a certain distance from an object.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: File Locator
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The location of a fragment of text or other information in a support file.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: Application schemas must describe how the associated file is identified. The associated file will commonly be named in a file reference co-attribute of the same complex attribute. Each DCEG must specify requirements for the format of the associated file and the semantics of file locator. For example, the value of file locator may be an HTML ID in an HTML file, line number in a text file) or a bookmark in a PDF file.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: File Reference
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The file name of an externally referenced text file.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Frequency Band
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: A continuous set of frequencies lying between two specified limiting frequencies. (Rec. ITU-R V.662-3)

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: LF
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Radio frequencies between 30 kHz and 300 kHz

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: MF
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Radio frequencies between 300 kHz and 3000 kHz

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: MF/HF
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Radio frequencies between 300 kHz and 30 MHz

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: HF
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Radio frequencies between 3 MHz and 30 MHz

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: VHF
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Radio frequencies between 30 MHz and 300 MHz

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: UHF
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Radio frequencies between 300 MHz and 3 GHz

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Frequency Shore Station Receives
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The shore station receiver frequency.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: Unit: Hertz(Hz); Example: 518kHz is to be coded as 518000.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Frequency Shore Station Transmits
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The shore station transmitter frequency.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: Unit: Hertz(Hz); Example: 518kHz is to be coded as 518000.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Frequency Limit Lower
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Lower limit of the frequency range in Hz.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Frequency Limit Upper
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Upper limit of the frequency range in Hz.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Headline
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Words set at the head of a passage or page to introduce or categorize.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Hours of Watch
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The hours during which the watch on the radio channel is maintained. Hours are given in UTC, such as 0930-1000, or by using a service symbol such as "H24" for a 24 hour service.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Horizontal Distance Uncertainty
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The best estimate of the horizontal accuracy of horizontal clearances and distances.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Id METAREA
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The identifier for a METAREA.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: Only the roman number part of the METAREA is to be coded.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Id NAVAREA
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The identifier for a NAVAREA.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: Only the roman number part of the NAVAREA is to be coded.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: In Ballast
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Whether the vessel is in ballast.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Information Confidence
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The likelihood that a vessel will experience the phenomenon described by a feature, or that the service described by the feature will be available.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Virtually Certain
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Virtually certain to be experienced by (or available to) an individual vessel; will be experienced by nearly all vessels.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: High Likelihood
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Frequently experienced by (or available to) an individual vessel; experienced by a majority of vessels.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Medium Likelihood
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Occasionally experienced by (or available to) an individual vessel; experienced by (or available to) about half of all vessels.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Low Likelihood
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Unlikely, but sometimes (rarely) experienced by (or available to) an individual vessel; experienced by (or available to) a minority of vessels.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Interoperability Identifier
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: A common unique identifier for entities which describe a single real-world feature, and which is used to identify instances of the feature in end-user systems where the feature may be included in multiple data product types.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Is MRCC
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: A statement that expresses if a Coast Guard station performs the function of a Maritime Rescue and Coordination Centre.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: A True value is an indication that an encoded Coast Guard station performs the function of a Maritime Rescue and Coordination Centre.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Language
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The method of human communication, either spoken or written, consisting of the use of words in a structured and conventional way.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: The language is encoded by a 3 character code following ISO 639-2/T.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Language Information
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: A description of the languages, alphabets and scripts in use.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Linkage
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Location (address) for online access using a URL/URI address or similar addressing scheme.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Logical Connectives
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Expresses whether all the constraints described by its co-attributes must be satisfied, or only one such constraint need be satisfied.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: Is intended to be used with co-attributes that encode limits on vessel dimensions, type of cargo, and other characteristics. The combination of constraints described by logicalConnectives and its co-attributes defines a subset of vessels to which information described by a feature or information type instance applies (or does not apply, is required, recommended, etc.). The relationship between the vessel subset and the information is indicated by an association - see PermissionType and InclusionType). The two listed values of logicalConnective are two of the basic operations of Boolean logic. The third basic operation (not) is not used.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Logical Conjunction
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: All the conditions described by the other attributes of the object, or sub-attributes of the same complex attribute, are true.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Logical Disjunction
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: At least one of the conditions described by the other attributes of the object, or sub-attributes of the same complex attributes, is true.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Maximum Data Burst Volume
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Maximum data burst volume in bytes

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Maximum Display Scale
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The value considered by the Data Producer to be the maximum (largest) scale at which the data is to be displayed before it can be considered to be "grossly overscaled".

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Membership
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Indicates whether a vessel is included or excluded from the regulation/restriction/recommendation/nautical information.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Included
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Vessels with these characteristics are included in the regulation/restriction/recommendation/nautical information.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Excluded
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Vessels with these characteristics are excluded from the regulation/restriction/recommendation/nautical information.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Minimum Display Scale
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The smallest intended viewing scale for the data.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Minimum Received Power
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Minimum received power in dBm.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Minimum Signal to Interference Noise Ratio
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The minimum value of Signal to Interference plus Noise Ratio (SINR) in dB.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Minute Past Even Hours
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The minute past even hours when a routine transmission starts.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: Minute (time) is a closed interval going from 0 to 59 seconds (time) and indicated the duration of a period of time.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Minute Past Every Hour
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The minute past every hour when a routine transmission starts.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: Minute (time) is a closed interval going from 0 to 59 seconds (time) and indicated the duration of a period of time.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Minute Past Odd Hours
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The minute past odd hours when a routine transmission starts.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: Minute (time) is a closed interval going from 0 to 59 seconds (time) and indicated the duration of a period of time.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: MMSI Code
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The Maritime Mobile Service Identity (MMSI) Code is formed of a series of nine digits which are transmitted over the radio path in order to uniquely identify ship stations, ship earth stations, coast stations, coast earth stations, and group calls. These identities are formed in such a way that the identity or part thereof can be used by telephone and telex subscribers connected to the general telecommunications network principally to call ships automatically.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: MSI Coastal Warning Area
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The coastal warning area identification letter(s) to be selected to receive the Maritime Safety Information (MSI) for the corresponding coastal warning area(s).
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: For example, ABCEFKM

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Name
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The individual name of a feature.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Name of Resource
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Name of the online resource.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Name Usage
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Classification of the type and display level of the name of a feature in an end-user system.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Default Name Display
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The name is intended to be displayed when the end-user system is set to the default name/text display setting.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Alternate Name Display
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The name is intended to be displayed when the end-user system is set to an alternate name/text display setting, for example an alternate language.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: No Chart Display
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The name or text is not intended to be displayed.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Nationality
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Identifier of membership of a particular nation.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Observation Time
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The time on each day when observations are made.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Optimum Display Scale
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The largest intended viewing scale for the data.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Orientation Uncertainty
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The best estimate of the accuracy of a bearing.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Orientation Value
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The angular distance measured from true north to the major axis of the feature.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Packet Delay
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Packet delay in ms

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Pictorial Representation
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The file name of an externally referenced picture file.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: The 'pictorial representation' could be a drawing or a photo. The string encodes the file name of an external graphic file (pixel/vector).

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Picture Caption
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Short description of the purpose of the image.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Picture Information
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: A set of information to provide credits to picture creator, copyright owner etc.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Postal Code
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Known in various countries as a postcode, or ZIP code, the postal code is a series of letters and/or digits that identifies each postal delivery area.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Presumed Receiver Antenna Height
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Presumed receiver antenna height for the calculation of radio coverage.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Quality of Horizontal Measurement
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The degree of reliability attributed to a position.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Approximate
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A position that is considered to be less than third-order accuracy, but is generally considered to be within 30.5 metres of its correct geographic location. Also may apply to a feature whose position does not remain fixed.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Remote Controlled
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: A statement that expresses if it is remote controlled.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Reported Date
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The date that the item was observed, done, or investigated.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Satellite Ocean Region
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The identifier of the ocean region area, within which a station can obtain line-of-sight communication, with an Inmarsat satellite.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: To be coded by using the name such as IOR, POR, AOR-E, or AOR-W.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Scale Minimum
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The minimum scale at which the feature may be used for example for ECDIS presentation.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Sector Bearing
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: A sector is the part of a circle between two straight lines drawn from the centre to the circumference. Sector bearing specifies the limit of the sector.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: The values given to the common limits of adjacent sectors should be identical. The orientation of bearing is from seaward to the central object. This conforms with the method used in 'List of Lights' publications. A generic term such as 'to shore' cannot be used; a specific bearing must be encoded. Where a light sector limit is defined as 'to the shore', it should be encoded using a value that ensures that, when the limit is drawn, it will fall entirely on land.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Sector Line Length
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: A sector is the part of a circle between two straight lines drawn from the centre to the circumference. Sector line length specifies the displayed length of the line, in ground units, defining the limit of the sector.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Selective Call Number
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: When stations of the maritime mobile service (direct printing telegraphy) use selective calling devices, their Selective Call numbers (SELCAL) are formed of four digits (coast stations).

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Serving Mobile Satellite Service
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The Recognized Mobile Satellite Service (RMSS) providing the service through a satellite system that is recognized by the IMO, for use in the GMDSS

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Inmarsat SafetyNET
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: An international automatic direct-printing satellite-based service using Inmarsat C Enhanced Group Call (EGC) system for the promulgation of Maritime Safety Information (MSI), navigational and meteorological warnings, meteorological forecasts, Search and Rescue (SAR) related information and other urgent safety-related messages to ships.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Iridium SafetyCast
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A service based on Iridium mobile-satellite system for the promulgation of Maritime Safety Information (MSI), navigational and meteorological warnings, meteorological forecasts, SAR-related information and other urgent safety-related messages to ships.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Source Date
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The production date of the source; for example the date of measurement.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Source
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The publication, document, or reference work from which information comes or is acquired.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Status
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The condition of an object at a given instant in time.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Permanent
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Intended to last or function indefinitely.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Occasional
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Acting on special occasions; happening irregularly.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Not in Use
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Use has ceased, but the facility still exists intact; disused.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Periodic/Intermittent
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Recurring at intervals.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Temporary
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Meant to last only for a time.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Private
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Administered by an individual or corporation, rather than a State or a public body.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Public
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Belonging to, available to, used or shared by, the community as a whole and not restricted to private use.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Watched
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Looked at or observed over a period of time especially so as to be aware of any movement or change.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Unwatched
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Usually automatic in operation, without any permanently-stationed personnel to superintend it.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Strong
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Not easily broken or destroyed.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Good
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: In a satisfactory condition to use.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Moderately
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Fairly but not very.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Poor
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Not as good as it could be or should.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Subject Description
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Descriptions of the subject of the transmitted message.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Subject or Message Type Code
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: A code specified for a communication system to indicate the subject group or message type of the transmitted content, e.g., message type of DGNSS, subject code for NAVDAT, or subject indicator character for NAVTEX.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Telecommunication Identifier
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: An identifier, such as words, numbers, letters, symbols, or any combination of those used to establish a contact to a particular person, organisation or service.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Telecommunication Service
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Classification of methods of communication over a distance by electrical, electronic, or electromagnetic means.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Voice
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The transfer or exchange of information by using sounds that are being made by mouth and throat when speaking.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Facsimile
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A system of transmitting and reproducing graphic matter (as printing or still pictures) by means of signals sent over telephone lines.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: SMS
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Short Message Service is a form of text messaging communication on phones and mobile phones.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Data
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A representation of facts, concepts or instructions in a formalised manner suitable for communication, interpretation or processing.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Streamed Data
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Data that is constantly received by and presented to an end-user while being delivered by a provider.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Telex
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A system of communication in which messages are sent over long distances by using a telephone system and are printed by using a special machine (called a teletypewriter).

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Telegraph
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: An apparatus, system or process for communication at a distance by electric transmission over wire.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Email
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Messages and other data exchanged between individuals using computers in a network.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Text
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: A non-formatted digital text string.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: Should be used, for example, to hold the information that is for short cautionary or explanatory notes. Therefore, text populated in text must not exceed 300 characters. Text may be in English, or in a national language. No formatting of text is possible within text. If formatted text, or text strings exceeding 300 characters, is required, then an alternate concept should be used.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Text Offset Bearing
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The angular distance measured from true north that text associated with a feature is positioned from the feature in an end-user system.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Text Offset Distance
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The distance that text associated with a feature is positioned from the feature in an end-user system.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Text Rotation
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: A statement that expresses if text associated with a feature is to be rotated in the ECDIS display or not.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Text Type
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The attribute from which a text string is derived.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Name
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The individual name of a feature.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Feature Characteristic
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A distinguishing trait, quality, or property of a feature class.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Thickness of Ice Capability
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The thickness of ice that the ship can safely transit.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Time of Day End
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The time corresponding to the end of an active period.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: The time of day end must be encoded using 2 digits for the hour (hh), 2 digits for the minutes(mm) and 2 digits for the seconds (ss). This conforms to ISO 8601:2004.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Time of Day Start
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The time corresponding to the start of an active period.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: The time of day start must be encoded using 2 digits for the hour (hh), 2 digits for the minutes(mm) and 2 digits for the seconds (ss). This conforms to ISO 8601:2004.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Transmission Content
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Content of transmission.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: Other than MSI.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Transmitter Identification Character
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The NAVTEX transmitter identification character is a single unique letter, which is allocated to each transmitter. It is used to identify the broadcasts, which are to be accepted by the receiver, those which are to be rejected, and the time slot for the transmission.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: The transmitter identification character should be indicated by a single character (A-Z).

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Transmission of Traffic Lists
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Describes whether a station transmits traffic lists.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Transmission Power
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The maximum power the radio service uses (or is authorized to use) for radio transmission.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: The calculation of the power depends on the type of signal. The value encoded must be the actual transmission power, if this is known to be different from the authorized transmission power. (47 CFR 80.215 (19 April 2017), adapted.)

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Transmission Regularity
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Classification of regularity or conditions for transmission.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Continuous
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Transmission is made continuously.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Regular
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Transmission is made regularly according to a schedule.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: On Receipt
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Transmission is made when warning or information is received from another authority.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: As Required
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Transmission is made under specified conditions or when needed.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: On Request
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: When you ask for it.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Transmission Time
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The time in the day when scheduled transmissions start.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Type of Broadcast Content
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Categorization of the broadcast content by subject.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Navigational warnings
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Messages containing urgent information relevant to safe navigation broadcast to ships in accordance with the provisions of the International Convention for the Safety of Life at Sea, 1974.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Meteorological warnings and forecasts
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Marine meteorological warning and forecast information in accordance with the provisions of the International Convention for the Safety of Life at Sea, 1974

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: SAR Information
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Broadcast message with information about an ongoing Search and Rescue operation.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Marine security or piracy warnings
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Security-related requirements in accordance to International Ship and Port Facility Security (ISPS) Code, or warnings related to acts of piracy and armed robbery against ships

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Tsunamis or natural phenomena warnings
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Warnings realted to tsunamis and other natural phenomena, such as abnormal changes to sea level

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Pilot and VTS service messages
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Messages related to pilot and VTS service, such as temporary alterations, movement or suspension to pilot or VTS services

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Military information
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Information concerning military events, such as military exercises, missile firings.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Special service or application specific messages
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Broadcast for special services or other application specific messages

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Ice Report
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Report of the ice situation and restrictions to shipping.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Type of Connectivity Resource
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Categorization of the connectivity resource by Quality o Service (QoS).

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Guaranteed Bit Rate
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The type of Quality of Service (QoS) Flow or a QoS parameter that defines the minimum data rate that must be guaranteed for a specific service or traffic flow.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Non-Guaranteed Bit Rate
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The type of Quality of Service (QoS) Flow that does not provide the end-user a guaranteed flow bit rate, typically used for non-time-sensitive applications, e.g., web browsing, buffered streaming, and instant messenger applications

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Delay Critical Guaranteed Bit Rate
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The type of Quality of Service (QoS) Flow that provides latencies significantly lower than guaranteed flow bit rate. Typically used in mission critical application like automation or intelligent transportation systems

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Best Effort
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The network or service that does not support quality of service, does its best to deliver packets, but does not guarantee delivery or control delay

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Type of NAVTEX Service
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Type of service of the NAVTEX, an international one or a national one. (IMO MSC.1/Circ.1403/Rev.2 NAVTEX Manual)

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: International NAVTEX
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The coordinated broadcast and automatic reception on 518 kHz of maritime safety information by means of narrow-band direct-printing telegraphy using the English language. (IMO MSC.1/Circ.1403/Rev.2 NAVTEX Manual)

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: national NAVTEX
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The broadcast and automatic reception of maritime safety information by means of narrow-band direct-printing telegraphy using frequencies other than 518 kHz and languages as decided by the Administration concerned. (IMO MSC.1/Circ.1403/Rev.2 NAVTEX Manual)

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Type of Radio Service
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Categorization of the radio service by the technology or system

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Digital Selective Calling (DSC)
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Radio service using digital selective calling (DSC) techniques.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Radio Telephony (RT)
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Radio service using radio telephony (RT).

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Public correspondence service (CP)
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Radio service with the coast station providing a public correspondence service.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Radio Telegraphy (WT)
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Radio service using Radio Telegraphy (WT)

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Radiotelex (NBDP telegraphy)
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Radio service using Narrow-Band Direct-Printing (NBDP) telegraphy

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Radio facsimile
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Radio service using radio facsimile

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Digital
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Radio service using digital modulation in the transmitted signal

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Data
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Radio service using data communication

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: NAVTEX
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The system for the broadcast and automatic reception of maritime safety information by means of narrow-band direct-printing telegraphy.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Enhanced Group Call (EGC)
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The broadcast of coordinated maritime safety information and search and rescue related information, to a defined geographical area using a recognized mobile satellite service.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: AIS
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Automatic Identification System

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: ASM
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Application Specific Message

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Satellite communication
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Communication using a satellite system

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: NAVDAT
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A digital system referred to as navigational data for broadcasting maritime safety and security related information from shore-to-ship

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Uncertainty Fixed
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The best estimate of the fixed horizontal or vertical accuracy component for positions, depths, heights, vertical distances and vertical clearances.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Uncertainty Variable Factor
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The factor to be applied to the variable component of an uncertainty equation so as to provide the best estimate of the variable horizontal or vertical accuracy component for positions, depths, heights, vertical distances and vertical clearances.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Uplink Bandwidth
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Uplink bandwith in Mbps

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Vessels Characteristics
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Characteristics of vessels.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Length Overall
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The maximum length of the ship.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Length at Waterline
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The ship's length measured at the waterline.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Breadth
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The width or beam of the vessel.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Draught
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The depth of water necessary to float a vessel fully loaded.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Displacement Tonnage
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A measurement of the weight of the vessel, usually used for warships. (Merchant ships are usually measured based on the volume of cargo space; see tonnage). Displacement is expressed either in long tons of 2,240 pounds or metric tonnes of 1,000 kg. Since the two units are very close in size (2,240 pounds = 1,016 kg and 1,000 kg = 2,205 pounds), it is common not to distinguish between them. To preserve secrecy, nations sometimes misstate a warship's displacement.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Displacement Tonnage, Light
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The weight of the ship excluding cargo, fuel, ballast, stores, passengers, and crew, but with water in the boilers to steaming level.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Displacement Tonnage, Loaded
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The weight of the ship including cargo, passengers, fuel, water, stores, dunnage and such other items necessary for use on a voyage, which brings the vessel down to her load draft.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Deadweight Tonnage
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The difference between displacement, light and displacement, loaded. A measure of the ship's total carrying capacity.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Gross Tonnage
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The entire internal cubic capacity of the ship expressed in tons of 100 cubic feet to the ton, except certain spaces with are exempted such as: peak and other tanks for water ballast, open forecastle bridge and poop, access of hatchways, certain light and air spaces, domes of skylights, condenser, anchor gear, steering gear, wheel house, galley and cabin for passengers.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Net Tonnage
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Obtained from the gross tonnage by deducting crew and navigating spaces and allowances for propulsion machinery.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Panama Canal/Universal Measurement System Net Tonnage
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The Panama Canal/Universal Measurement System (PC/UMS) is based on net tonnage, modified for Panama Canal purposes. PC/UMS is based on a mathematical formula to calculate a vessel's total volume; a PC/UMS net ton is equivalent to 100 cubic feet of capacity.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Suez Canal Net Tonnage
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The Suez Canal Net Tonnage (SCNT) is derived with a number of modifications from the former net register tonnage of the Moorsom System and was established by the International Commission of Constantinople in its Protocol of 18 December 1873. It is still in use, as amended by the Rules of Navigation of the Suez Canal Authority, and is registered in the Suez Canal Tonnage Certificate.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Vessels Characteristics Unit
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The unit used for vessel characteristics attribute.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Metres
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The basic unit of length in the International System of Units (SI) system.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Metric Ton
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The tonne or metric ton (U.S.), often redundantly referred to as a metric tonne, is a unit of mass equal to 1,000 kg (2,205 lb) or approximately the mass of one cubic metre of water at four degrees Celsius. It is sometimes abbreviated as mt in the United States, but this conflicts with other SI symbols. The tonne is not a unit in the International System of Units (SI), but is accepted for use with the SI. In SI units and prefixes, the tonne is a megagram (Mg). The Imperial and US customary units comparable to the tonne are both spelled ton in English, though they differ in mass. Pronunciation of tonne (the word used in the UK) and ton is usually identical, but is not too confusing unless accuracy is important as the tonne and UK long ton differ by only 1.6.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Ton
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Long ton (weight ton or imperial ton) is the name for the unit called the "ton" in the avoirdupois or Imperial system of measurements, as used in the United Kingdom and several other Commonwealth countries. It has been mostly replaced by the tonne, and in the United States by the short ton. One long ton is equal to 2,240 pounds (1,016 kg) or 35 cubic feet (0.9911 m) of salt water with a density of 64 lb/ft (1.025 g/ml). It has some limited use in the United States, most commonly in measuring the displacement of ships, and was the unit prescribed for warships by the Washington Naval Treaty for example battleships were limited to a mass of 35,000 long tons (36,000 t; 39,000 ST).

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Short Ton
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A unit of weight equal to 2,000 pounds (907.18474 kg). In the United States it is often called simply ton without distinguishing it from the metric ton (tonne, 1,000 kilograms) or the long ton (2,240 pounds / 1,016.0469088 kilograms); rather, the other two are specifically noted. There are, however, some US applications for which unspecified tons normally means long tons (for example, Navy ships) or metric tons (world grain production figures).
